intro: Hyptis multibracteata, commonly known as the Brazilian hyptis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are clustered in dense whorls, producing small, tubular blooms in shades of purple or blue. Hyptis multibracteata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
